intro: Casearia parhamii, commonly known as the West African casearia, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
